channel.title: Metaphysics on Randy Ridenour
channel.description: Recent content in Metaphysics on Randy Ridenour

item.title: Permanent Impermanence
item.description: As I wrote recently, everything in existence is permanently impermanent. Patrick Rhone I detect shades of Heraclitus here. Question: is this a paradox? Answer: probably not, unless Rhone is committed to the belief that nothing at all, even impermanence, is permanent. It is a good opportunity to do some analytic philosophy, though. What is permanence? Is it a real property, or is it a derivative analyzed in terms of the real properties of an object?
